item.value: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain in the world. It is 8850 meters (29035ft) high.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
The earth is the 3rd planet from the sun and is the 5th largest planet in our solar system. Jupiter is the largest planet.
The South Pole is the least sunny placeon earth with only 182 days a year off sunshine
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants. Los Angeles is in second place. It has 3.8 million people.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon.
The creator of the first working light bulb was Joseph Wilson Swan. Thomas Edison improved on Swan's design by using a better incandescent material and a higher vacuum.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
Elephants demonstrate concern for members of their families they take care of weak or injured members and appear to grieve over a dead companion.
About two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. Mature blue whales can measure anywhere from 75 feet (23 m) to 100 feet (30.5 m) long and can weigh as much as 150 tons.
In the Summer of 1896 the first modern Olympics was held in Athens, Greece. The 2012 Olympics will be held in London.
The launch of the Russian Spiknit 1 spcecraft started the 'space race' between Russia and America. Explorer 1 was the first spacecraft launched by the United States on 31 January 1958.
Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
Tides are caused by the rotation of the Earth and the gravitational effects of the Moon and Sun.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.

The Spine-tailed Swift is the fastest bird. It can fly at 170 kilometres per hour (105mph). The Peregrine Falcon is the fastest bird that dives headfirst down through the sky. They can travel at up to 200mph.
House flies have a lifespan of two weeks.
Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press in 1436 . Gutenberg is also accredited with printing the world's first book known as the Gutenberg Bible.
